org.semanticweb.kaon2.api.formatting
Interface FormattingElementCursor

public interface FormattingElementCursor

This interface allows to iterate and manipulate formatting elements in an ontology. At any given instant, an object of this class is positioned either before the first element, after the last element, or on some formatting element. If the current formatting element is an axiom, this axiom can be retrieved using getCurrentAxiom(); if the current formatting element is not an axiom, then getCurrentAxiom() returns null. The text of the current formattig element can be retrieved using getCurrentText(). Certain axioms may not have text associated with them; in this case, getCurrentText() returns null. Formatting elements can be deleted, after which the cursor moves to either the previous of the next element. It is important to understand that axiom formatting elements represent only information about axiom formatting, and not the axioms themselves. Therefore, if an axiom formatting element is deleted, the axiom is not deleted from the ontology. Each axiom in the ontology must be represented by a formatting element, so deleting an axiom formatting element actually creates a new formatting element at the end of the ontology with the deleted axiom and the empty text. This class does not ensure syntactic correctness of the texts it keeps. As with Java collections, one should not modify the underlying formatting object while iterating over it using a cursor, as this might leave the cursor in an inconsistent state. The ontology is locked for reading while a cursor is active. After a cursor is not needed any more, it should be disposed of by a call to the close() method; this unlocks the ontology and disposes of other resources.

delete

void delete(boolean moveNext)
            throws KAON2Exception
Deletes the current formatting element. If formatting elements corresponding to axioms are deleted, then the axioms are placed to the end of the ontology with no formatting. (Namely, an axiom can be deleted from the formatting only if it is deleted from the ontology.)

Parameters:
moveNext - after deletion, if this parameter is true, the iterator is moved to the next element and otherwise to the previous one
Throws:
KAON2Exception - thrown if there is an error

getCurrentAxiom

Axiom getCurrentAxiom()
                      throws KAON2Exception
Returns the axiom of the current formatting element. If the current formatting element corresponds to whitespace, then this method returns null.

Returns:
the axiom of the current formatting element (or null if the current formatting element corresponds to whitespace)
Throws:
KAON2Exception - thrown if there is an error

getCurrentText

java.lang.String getCurrentText()
                                throws KAON2Exception
Returns the text at the current formatting element. If the current formatting element corresponds to an axiom for which no formatting has been stored, then this method returns null.

Returns:
the text at the current formatting element (or null if the current formatting element corresponds to an axiom without formatting)
Throws:
KAON2Exception - thrown if there is an error

setCurrentText

void setCurrentText(java.lang.String text)
                    throws KAON2Exception
Sets the text of the current formatting element.

Parameters:
text - the text to be set
Throws:
KAON2Exception - thrown if there is an error

           throws KAON2Exception
Closes the cursor, unlocks the ontology, and releases all resources used.

Throws:
KAON2Exception - thrown if there is an error
